flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • Project box
  • 1/4W 470 ohm resistor
  • LED, Red
  • Panel-mount LED holder
  • Wire
  • Solder
  • Circuit that shocks With 2 contacts
Tools
  • Drill
  • Drill bit
  • Soldering iron
  • screw driver

lines.text: The circuit I used was an inverter from an old scanner, and it seemed to shock, so I used it.
lines.text_raw: The circuit I used was an inverter from an old scanner, and it seemed to shock, so I used it.

lines.text: You want a slow and steady shock that does not hurt too much, but is like shocking gag toys.
lines.text_raw: You want a slow and steady shock that does not hurt too much, but is like shocking gag toys.

lines.text: Stuff the whole thing in the enclosure
lines.text_raw: Stuff the whole thing in the enclosure

lines.text: It is a good Idea to use cushions on the parts, so they don't break by a rough fall. A cheap solution is paper, just crumple it up.
lines.text_raw: It is a good Idea to use cushions on the parts, so they don't break by a rough fall. A cheap solution is paper, just crumple it up.

lines.text: Screw on all the panel mounted parts, Like switch 1, 2, the Led, and not to mention holes for the tazer parts
lines.text_raw: Screw on all the panel mounted parts, Like switch 1, 2, the Led, and not to mention holes for the tazer parts

lines.text: If you just seal this thing up without some customization, then you  will have a dull boring box that shocks.
lines.text_raw: If you just seal this thing up without some customization, then you  will have a dull boring box that shocks.

lines.text: Print or draw some crazy labels
lines.text_raw: Print or draw some crazy labels

guide.summary: Annoying brothers, Lack of fun, Bored? All are solved with this wonderful project.
guide.title: Make the Printazer
